name: Driftwood Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We experienced the same owner rudeness the other reviewers have expressed. We asked to see the room before staying. We were interested in watching a particular program on TV that night and had problems the previous night at a different hotel with the TV. When my husband asked the owner if the TV worked he went off on him and then told us he assumed we wanted to keep looking for a different place to stay. Of course we obliged, went next door to a very friendly, courteous and smiling clerk at Inn at Old Town for $65/night.
reviews.title: Don't they want your business?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped late and asked for the best rate possible. Told lady just wanted the cheapest rate as we we getting a few hours sleep and heading out in the early am. Lady was the most rude person I ever experienced in the motel business. She said " if you want cheap then go to motel next door" on and on, so I obliged her and left. I took my $100.00 and went to the Table Rock Motel. People were wonderful, rooms clean, view great!
reviews.title: Don't stay there!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped at this motel after not finding any others less than $120 a night. The clerk was pleasant. The room was nice and clean with a mural painted on the interior wall. However, if you like sleeping on a concrete slab, you'll love their beds. This was by far the hardest bed I have ever attempted to sleep on. My other half took the bed spread, folded it up, and put it under her covers to try and get some comfort. We got very little sleep. The 'continental' breakfast was bare bones; mini muffins, coffee, mini juice cans, and mini bagels, and you had to haul back to your room to eat it.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: Not sure about the other reviews, but I had a great stay, the owners were friendly and I felt like I was staying at a friends place. you really get the small town feel
reviews.title: Great little family place
A pleasant surprise
reviews.text: I don't review much, but I decided to give this motel a review because it was so pleasant. I am quite surprised to see negative reviews. I was impressed with the great value of this motel. The room was spotless and well-furnished with microwave, mini-fridge, and wi-fi. Check-in staff were very friendly and welcoming. The hotel has a great location and is next to a coffee shop in town. Rooms are quiet because they face away from 101. I would absolutely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are on a road trip in southern Oregon this motel is by far the best we have stayed in. Reasonable cost , very clean , good facilities, just on edge of lovely town of Brandon. If we passed this way again would defo stay here.
reviews.title: Great Motel

reviews.text: This was my 2nd time staying here, and I was remember from 6 months before.... That was great.... Owners are wonderful/kind/and animal lovers... don't see how they or their place can get a bad review... ppl do get tired... don't forget the owners are human too.... going to be coming back in about 24 hrs.... can't wait...
reviews.title: Awesome.....Beautiful....... will come back again and again and again...

reviews.text: We spend one night there last summer, but were ripped off by owner. She refused to accommodate us in single room, arguing that it is "too small" and made us pay for two room instead. I was too tired to argue back, but should have, since she was evidently lying in order to make more business. The rooms are spacious, but dark and expensive, no matter there is a poor breakfast included. You are going to find much better place to spend summer night at beautiful Oregon coast!
reviews.title: You should look for better place!

reviews.text: My first time to Bandon Ore, to visit a dear dear friend and i stayed at the Driftwood Motel and it was AWESOME.. The managers/owners were pleasent, kind, funny, and helpful. Had a way cool little coffee shop next door.. Old town just down the block.. Im surprised to see the bad reviews on this place.. I will stay here again....Tho this time im movin on upstairs.. It was pretty much home away from home... Cant wait to get back to Bandon.....
reviews.title: WONDERFUL

reviews.text: Looked like a nice quiet place - boy are appearances deceiving! The "owner" verbally abused our party of four for smoking in the parking lot. Screamed that we were too close to the building (actually, we weren't) and customer on the top floor was complaining of smoke. Who puts a smoking floor on the bottom??? Conventional wisdom dictates that smoke rises...right??? Did I mention ashtrays were permanently afixed to the wall next to the door? Perhaps a placard indicating the state law for those unlucky out of town travelers stupid enough to stay here. Save your money and sleep in a box.
reviews.title: Manager Psychotic - don't stay here!!!!!

reviews.text: We picked this place because it looked clean and quiet. I went in to get a room and the owner told me too go somewhere else while he was yelling at me. He had the police there to deal with one of his tenants (that's when I should have ran the other way) and I guess he was angry because of it and totally took it out on me. Trust me when I say this guy is in the wrong business. He is not a people person. Spend your money else where.
reviews.title: Rudest Owner - EVER

reviews.text: The Owners Are Very Rude!!! They Are Inconvenienced By Their Customers. That is the Attitude they Express. We did not know we couldn't use our camp Grill to Grill Dinner and We were Rudely Interupted by the Owner Yelling and Screeming, Cursing over and over at us. I have never been treated so rudely especially by someone who I am a guest of their hotel. I would Highly Suggest against staying at the Driftwood Motel!!!
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Experience Ever!!!

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Driftwood motel several times and have always found it to be clean, safe, quiet, and friendly. We like staying in the rooms on the second floor looking over old town Bandon. Rooms are nice and quiet...love that. My teenage son and I enjoy the walk over to "Old town" to have dinner. In the morning there is a wonderful bakery within walking distance. A great place to stay and will continue to do so.
reviews.title: Quite a nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Bandon outside tourist season late one afternoon without a booking and settled on the Driftwood, right by downtown (if you can call the village centre that!)
reviews.title: Gruff but friendly reception and very spacious rooms
If this is a 2 star motel, Bates Motel would get 3 stars
reviews.text: The manager was friendly enough (think he'd had enough of the tourists by this point in the season) and the room was lovely - clean, spacious, great bathroom, reasonable toiletries, and nice to have a balcony (with a sea view if you squinted). Basic but well worth the rates.

description: Family owned and operated for twenty years, this 22 unit property is located in the heart of beautiful Bandon-by-the-Sea on the Oregon Coast. Nicely maintained grounds and updated rooms show pride of ownership throughout the motel. Units are well appointed with one or two queen beds and all feature hairdryers, microwaves, and refrigerators. Beautiful hand-painted murals done by a local artist decorate the rooms for a very unique view of Bandon. Two suites available with full kitchens; living rooms and separate bedrooms with two bathrooms - great for families!Free wi-fi and a complimentary continental breakfast are available with a coffee shop located right next door. And the location is an added plus - across the street from the boat basin and Old Town, balcony views of the Coquille River are great for spectacular sunsets and a great spot to catch the 4th of July firework display. Great restaurants featuring unique cuisines are located within walking distance along with crabbing, fishing, kayaking, boating and beach combing. Bandon Museum is a quick walk away as are many shops and galleries.
